title: How to Write a Waste Management Plan

steps.title: Describe and calculate all types and quantities of waste involved in your project.
steps.content: Describe and calculate all types and quantities of waste involved in your project. Obvious types of waste include building scraps, waste water, natural materials, and human waste. Remember to account for secondary forms of waste including trash produced by building crews and excavated materials.

steps.title: Divide your waste into refuse, recyclables and reusable waste.
steps.content: Divide your waste into refuse, recyclables and reusable waste.

steps.title: Describe how you will remove refuse waste including details about cost, removal crews, the types of vehicles used, and the location and type of the eventual refuse destination.
steps.content: Describe how you will remove refuse waste including details about cost, removal crews, the types of vehicles used, and the location and type of the eventual refuse destination.

steps.title: Account for the nature and removal of recyclables and indicate all types of recyclables as well as cost and who will be removing the recyclables and their ultimate destination.
steps.content: Account for the nature and removal of recyclables and indicate all types of recyclables as well as cost and who will be removing the recyclables and their ultimate destination.

steps.title: Describe the nature and utility of reusable waste including all information as well as any extra steps needed to clean or refurbish reusable waste.
steps.content: Describe the nature and utility of reusable waste including all information as well as any extra steps needed to clean or refurbish reusable waste.

steps.title: Provide instructions for the handling of all types of waste including detailed instructions for equipment needed when managing waste, as well as any safety procedures for waste crews.
steps.content: Provide instructions for the handling of all types of waste including detailed instructions for equipment needed when managing waste, as well as any safety procedures for waste crews.

steps.title: Draw up goals for waste reduction and indicate how refuse waste can be minimized with specific quantity goals for waste reduction.
steps.content: Draw up goals for waste reduction and indicate how refuse waste can be minimized with specific quantity goals for waste reduction.

steps.title: Divide instructions for managing waste for each contractor, subcontractor, or crew involved in the project.
steps.content: Divide instructions for managing waste for each contractor, subcontractor, or crew involved in the project. Include all aspects of the actual project as well as waste removal itself, making the responsibilities of each party clear and what information they need to know and share with other parties.

steps.title: Create a list of all waste removal sites, including dumpsters, junkyards, recycling centers, and the destinations of reusable waste.
steps.content: Create a list of all waste removal sites, including dumpsters, junkyards, recycling centers, and the destinations of reusable waste.

steps.title: List and add all information and costs including details about how your project complies with all laws governing the management and removal of waste.
steps.content: List and add all information and costs including details about how your project complies with all laws governing the management and removal of waste.
